revision.text:
{{pp-move-indef}} {{pp-semi-blp|small=yes}} {{Use British English|date=May 2011}} {{Use dmy dates|date=May 2011}} {{Infobox person | name = James Corden | honorific_suffix = [[Order of the British Empire|OBE]] | image = James Corden at 2015 PaleyFest.jpg | caption = Corden at the 2015 [[PaleyFest]] | birthname = James Kimberley Corden | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1978|8|22|df=yes}} | birth_place = [[Hillingdon]], [[London]], England | education = [[Holmer Green Senior School|Holmer Green Upper School]] | occupation = {{hlist|Actor|writer|producer|comedian|television host|singer}} | home_town = [[Hazlemere]], [[Buckinghamshire]], UK | residence = [[Los Angeles]], [[California]], U.S. | yearsactive = 1996–present | spouse = {{marriage|Julia Carey|2012}} | children = 3 | module = {{Infobox comedian|embed=yes | medium = {{hlist|Television|film|theatre}} | genre = {{hlist|[[Observational comedy]]|[[sketch comedy]]|[[Comedy music|musical comedy]]|[[physical comedy]]|[[satire]]}} | subject = {{hlist|[[Politics of the United Kingdom|British politics]]|[[Culture of England|English culture]]|[[American culture]]|[[current events]]|[[popular culture|pop culture]]|[[everyday life]]|[[Embarrassment|social awkwardness]]}} }} }}
'''James Kimberley Corden'''<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/people/news/james-corden-reveals-he-was-teased-over-middle-name-1921992.html|title=James Corden reveals he was teased over middle name|last=Shaw|first=Vicky|date=16 March 2010|work=[[The Independent]]}}</ref> {{postnom|country=UK|OBE}} (born 22 August 1978)<ref name=attentionplease>{{cite book|date=29 September 2011|author=James Corden|isbn=978-1-8460-5935-3|title=May I Have your Attention Please?|publisher=Century}}</ref> is an English actor, writer, producer, comedian, television host, and singer. He hosts ''[[The Late Late Show with James Corden]]'', a late-night television talk show on [[CBS]].
Along with Welsh actress [[Ruth Jones]], Corden co-created, co-wrote and starred in the critically acclaimed [[BBC]] sitcom ''[[Gavin & Stacey]]'' (2007–2010) for which he won the [[British Academy Television Awards|BAFTA Television Award]] for [[British Academy Television Award for Best Comedy Performance|Best Comedy Performance]]. He was featured on the UK No.1 single "[[Shout (Shout for England song)|Shout]]", along with [[Grime (music)|grime]] artist [[Dizzee Rascal]], an unofficial anthem of the England football team for the [[2010 FIFA World Cup]] in South Africa, and duetted with Australian singer [[Kylie Minogue]] on a cover of "[[Only You (Yazoo song)#Kylie Minogue version|Only You]]" in 2015. Appearing on the UK charity telethon [[Comic Relief]] in 2011, Corden created his [[Carpool Karaoke]] sketch when he drove around London singing songs with [[George Michael]]. Since 2009, Corden has presented the [[Brit Awards]] ceremony five times, four by himself and once with Minogue and [[Mathew Horne]]. In 2016, he hosted the [[70th Tony Awards]]; he went on to host the [[Grammy Awards]] in [[59th Annual Grammy Awards|2017]] and [[60th Annual Grammy Awards|2018]]. He has presented the sports-based comedy [[Panel discussion|panel]] show ''[[A League of Their Own (UK game show)|A League of Their Own]]'' on [[Sky 1]] since 2010.
In 2011, he played the lead part in the comedy play ''[[One Man, Two Guvnors]]'', which transferred from the [[Royal National Theatre|National Theatre]] to the [[West End theatre|West End]] and then to [[Broadway theatre|Broadway]] and was also cinecast worldwide via [[National Theatre Live]]. For his performance in the Broadway run of the play, Corden won the [[66th Tony Awards|Tony Award]] for [[Tony Award for Best Performance by a Leading Actor in a Play|Best Actor in a Play]].<ref name="unitedagents">[http://unitedagents.co.uk/james-corden#profile-1 Profile], [[United Agents]]; accessed 28 December 2014.</ref> In 2015 he received the [[BAFTA]] [[Britannia Awards|Britannia Award]] for British Artist of the Year.<ref name=bafta15>{{cite web|url=http://deadline.com/2015/08/britannia-awards-meryl-streep-sam-mendes-james-corden-1201502512/|title=Meryl Streep, Sam Mendes & James Corden To Be Lauded At 2015 Britannia Awards|website=[[Deadline Hollywood]]|date=20 August 2015}}</ref>
==Early life== Corden was born in [[Hillingdon]], [[Greater London]], the son of Margaret and Malcolm Corden. His father was a musician in the [[Royal Air Force]] band and his mother was a social worker.<ref name="thirdsector">{{cite web|url=http://www.thirdsector.co.uk/Communications/article/1180208/sharon-kelly-osbourne-give-backing-fashion-targets-breast-cancer-2013|title=Sharon and Kelly Osbourne give their backing to Fashion Targets Breast Cancer 2013|publisher=Thirdsector.co.uk|date=30 April 2013|accessdate=28 December 2014}}</ref> He grew up in [[Hazlemere]], [[Buckinghamshire]],<ref name="stannit"/> and attended Park Middle School and [[Holmer Green Senior School|Holmer Green Upper School]].<ref name=attentionplease/> He has an older sister, Andrea Henry, and a younger sister, Ruth Corden.<ref name="femail"/> He was raised in the [[Salvation Army]] church but no longer considers himself a Christian.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/3am/celebrity-news/james-corden-admits-turning-back-8648732|title=James Corden admits 'turning his back on Christian upbringing' after doubting his beliefs|date=17 August 2016|work=Daily Mirror|accessdate=21 September 2016}}</ref>
==Career==
===Early career=== Corden's first stage appearance was at the age of 18 with a one-line part in the 1996 musical ''[[Martin Guerre (musical)|Martin Guerre]]''.<ref name=guardian/> His first TV reporter role was on the BBC's ''[[Good Morning with Anne and Nick]]''.<ref>[https://www.vanityfair.com/hollywood/2016/08/james-corden-meat-loaf-interview-1995 Baby James Corden’s 1995 Meat Loaf Interview Is a Delight] ''Vanity Fair''. 23 August 2013. Retrieved 23 January 2018.</ref> His early television work included Gareth Jones in the 1999 series ''[[Boyz Unlimited]]''. He also starred in Tango advertisements in 1998 and had a role as a bookish student in ''[[Teachers (UK TV series)|Teachers]]'' and in 2000 a small part in an episode of ''[[Hollyoaks]]''. Corden had guest appearances on ''[[Little Britain]]'' and ''[[Dalziel and Pascoe]]'', both in 2004. Corden's early film credits include ''[[Whatever Happened to Harold Smith?]]'' (1999), [[Mike Leigh]]'s ''[[All or Nothing (film)|All or Nothing]]'' (2002), ''[[Heartlands (film)|Heartlands]]'' (2002), and ''[[Cruise of the Gods]]'' (2002).<ref name="imdb"/>
===Rise to prominence=== From 2000 through early 2005, Corden starred in the British television series ''[[Fat Friends]]'' as Jamie Rymer. He garnered a nomination for the 2000 [[Royal Television Society]] Award for Network Newcomer On Screen for his work. Beginning in 2004, Corden played the role of Timms in the original London stage production of [[Alan Bennett]]'s play ''[[The History Boys]]'', as well as in the [[Broadway (theatre)|Broadway]], Sydney, [[Wellington]] and Hong Kong productions and radio and [[The History Boys (film)|2006 film adaptation]] versions of the play.<ref name="Broadway"/><ref name="National Theatre"/><ref name="Wellington"/> Also in 2006, he appeared in the film ''[[Starter for 10 (film)|Starter for 10]]''.<ref name="imdb"/>
From 2007 through early 2010, Corden co-starred in his own series, the [[BBC Three]] sitcom ''[[Gavin & Stacey]]''. He co-wrote the series with his ''Fat Friends'' co-star [[Ruth Jones]]; Corden and Jones played the friends of the title characters, with Corden starring as Smithy. The series proved popular and was well-received critically. For the show, Corden won Best Male Comedy Performer and ''[[Gavin & Stacey]]'' won Best New British Television Comedy at the 2007 [[British Comedy Awards]].<ref name="sitcom"/> At the 2008 Television BAFTAs, Corden won the [[BAFTA]] for [[British Academy Television Award for Best Comedy Performance|Best Male Comedy Performance]], and ''Gavin & Stacey'' won the BAFTA's Audience Award for Programme of the Year.<ref name="unitedagents"/><ref name="bafta2008"/> In December 2008, the show won Best TV Comedy in the 2008 British Comedy Awards. ''Gavin & Stacey'' also won the award for Most Popular Comedy Programme at the [[National Television Awards]] in 2010.<ref name="who"/>
===Work outside ''Gavin & Stacey''=== During the two year, seven months run of ''Gavin & Stacey'', Corden's professional endeavours outside the successful series proved somewhat chequered.<ref name=guardian>Cochrane, Kira. [https://www.theguardian.com/culture/2011/oct/02/james-corden-actor-gavin-stacey "James Corden: 'I'm not sure people even think of me as an actor at all'"]. ''[[The Guardian]]'', 2 October 2011.</ref> He guest hosted ''[[Big Brother's Big Mouth]]'', with ''Gavin & Stacey'' co-star [[Mathew Horne]], in August 2007. In 2008, he appeared in the film of [[Toby Young]]'s autobiography ''[[How to Lose Friends & Alienate People (film)|How to Lose Friends & Alienate People]]''. He collaborated again with Horne on a 2009 sketch show named ''[[Horne & Corden]]'', described by the BBC as a "traditional comedy entertainment show in the style of [[Morecambe and Wise]]".<ref name="horne"/> The show ran for only one series and was poorly received by the critics, with Corden later admitting "the absolute truth is I wasn't good enough."<ref name="sketch"/>
In 2009, Corden starred as the lead character in the film ''[[Lesbian Vampire Killers]]'', which was not a success. That year he played [[Clem Cattini]] in the [[Joe Meek]] biopic ''[[Telstar (film)|Telstar]]'', and likewise in the animated ''[[Planet 51]]'' along with Mathew Horne.<ref name="imdb"/><ref name="horne"/> In February 2009, he co-presented the [[Brit Awards]] with Mathew Horne and [[Kylie Minogue]].<ref name="brit"/> On 13 March 2009, he appeared in a sketch for the UK charity telethon [[Red Nose Day 2009|Comic Relief]] giving the [[England national football team|England football team]] a motivational talk, and later presented a section with Horne showing their best bits of comedy from the previous two years along with highlights from the night.<ref name="horne"/>
In March 2010, Corden began hosting the [[Sky1]] comedy/sports panel show [[A League of Their Own (UK game show)|''A League of Their Own'']] alongside team captains [[Andrew Flintoff]] and [[Jamie Redknapp]]. In March 2010, he presented [[Sport Relief 2010]] alongside [[Davina McCall]] and others, and contributed a "sequel" to the 2009 England football team sketch, this time giving a motivational talk to various sports stars including [[David Beckham]] and motor racing driver [[Jenson Button]].<ref name="sport"/>
In March 2010, Corden took part in ''[[Channel 4's Comedy Gala]]'', a [[Benefit concert|benefit show]] held in aid of [[Great Ormond Street Hospital|Great Ormond Street Children's Hospital]], filmed live at the [[The O2 Arena (London)|O2 Arena]] in London. On 5 June 2010, he performed his England World Cup single with [[Dizzee Rascal]] on the finale of ''[[Britain's Got Talent]]''. The proceeds from the single went to London's [[Great Ormond Street Hospital]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Dizzee Rascal and James Corden record World Cup song|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/10225114|agency=BBC|date=12 November 2016}}</ref>
In June 2010, Corden played Craig Owens in the ''[[Doctor Who]]'' episode "[[The Lodger (Doctor Who)|The Lodger]]", in which [[Doctor (Doctor Who)|the Doctor]] moved in with him. Corden returned as Owens in "[[Closing Time (Doctor Who)|Closing Time]]" in the sixth series.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.radiotimes.com/news/2011-09-24/matt-smith-and-james-corden-talk-doctor-who/|title=Matt Smith and James Corden talk Doctor Who|work=Radio Times|access-date=2018-01-25|language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://ew.com/gallery/doctor-who-guest-stars/james-corden|title=19 Stars You Forgot Were on 'Doctor Who'|date=2016-08-29|work=EW.com|access-date=2018-01-25|language=en-US}}</ref> In December 2010, ''This Is [[JLS]]'', an hour-long Christmas special featuring the boyband and ''[[The X Factor (UK)|The X Factor]]'' runners-up, was aired on [[ITV1]], with Corden writing and producing some of the sketches featured in the special. In 2010, he also was in the main cast of the film ''[[Gulliver's Travels (2010 film)|Gulliver's Travels]]''.<ref name="imdb"/> In December 2010, he was part of an ensemble voice cast in the English dub of the German animated film ''[[Animals United]]'' alongside [[Jim Broadbent]], [[Jason Donovan]], [[Joanna Lumley]], [[Billie Piper]], [[Andy Serkis]] and others.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.radiotimes.com/film/9vs4/animals-united/|title=Animals United – review {{!}} cast and crew, movie star rating and where to watch film on TV and online|website=Radio Times|language=en|access-date=2018-01-25}}</ref>
===''One Man, Two Guvnors'' and other projects=== In February 2011, Corden again presented the [[2011 Brit Awards]]. In March, Corden reprised his ''Gavin & Stacey'' role as Smithy in a ''[[Red Nose Day]]'' sketch for the charity telethon Comic Relief. The sketch included appearances by then UK Prime Minister [[Gordon Brown]], [[JLS]], [[Paul McCartney]] and [[Justin Bieber]]. It received positive reviews from critics and was highly regarded as the best sketch of the night.<ref name="nose"/> The show also saw the first appearance of his [[The Late Late Show with James Corden#Recurring segments|Carpool Karaoke]] sketch, which saw him singing songs with pop star [[George Michael]] while driving around London.<ref>{{cite news|title=WATCH: James Corden’s first-ever Carpool Karaoke with George Michael|url=http://www.express.co.uk/showbiz/tv-radio/670762/The-Grand-Tour-when-motoring-show-starts-Amazon-Prime-Jeremy-Clarkson-Richard-Hammond-Jame|agency=Express|date=12 November 2016}}</ref> In 2011, he appeared in ''[[The Three Musketeers (2011 film)|The Three Musketeers]]''.<ref name="imdb">{{IMDb name|179479}}</ref>
Starting in June 2011, Corden played the lead role in the hit comedy play ''[[One Man, Two Guvnors]]''. The play was also cinecast worldwide as part of the [[National Theatre Live]] cinecasts, and transferred from the [[Royal National Theatre|National Theatre]] to the [[West End theatre|West End]] after touring. The show received universal critical acclaim and won Best Play at the [[Evening Standard Theatre Awards]] for 2011.<ref name="Broadway"/><ref name="seawards"/> ''[[The Guardian]]'' deemed it "A triumph of visual and verbal comedy. One of the funniest productions in the National's history."<ref>Billington, Michael. [https://www.theguardian.com/stage/2011/may/25/one-man-two-guvnors-review "'One Man, Two Guvnors' -- review"], guardian.co.uk, 24 May 2011.</ref> ''The Daily Telegraph'' described it as "the feelgood hit of the Summer";<ref>Spencer, Charles. [https://www.telegraph.co.uk/culture/theatre/theatre-reviews/8536319/One-Man-Two-Guvnors-National-Theatre-review.html "James Corden stars in the feelgood hit of the summer at the National Theatre"] telegraph.co.uk, 25 May 2011.</ref> while ''[[The Independent]]'' called it a "massive hit",<ref>Taylor, Paul. [https://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/theatre-dance/reviews/one-man-two-guvnors-national-theatre-lyttelton-london-2289003.html "'One Man, Two Guvnors', National Theatre: Lyttelton, London"] independent.co.uk, 26 May 2011.</ref> and the ''[[Evening Standard]]'' "a surefire hit".<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/theatre-dance/reviews/one-man-two-guvnors-national-theatre-lyttelton-london-2289003.html|title=One Man, Two Guvnors, National Theatre: Lyttelton, London, UK|location=London, UK|work=The Independent|first=Paul|last=Taylor|date=26 May 2011}}</ref>[[File:James Corden 2014.jpg|thumb|upright|right|Corden at the [[2014 British Academy Television Awards]], May 2014]]Corden made a cameo appearance in the music video for the single "[[Mama Do the Hump]]" by [[Rizzle Kicks]], released in December 2011, which reached #2 in the charts. In April 2012, ''One Man, Two Guvnors'' transferred to [[Broadway theatre|Broadway]], with Corden continuing to play the lead. In June 2012, he won the [[Tony Award]] for [[Tony Award for Best Performance by a Leading Actor in a Play|Best Performance by a Leading Actor in a Play]] for his performance.<ref name="unitedagents" />
In February 2012, Corden hosted the [[2012 BRIT Awards|Brit Awards]] for the third time. Corden starred as the Baker in the [[The Walt Disney Company|Disney]] [[Into the Woods (film)|film adaptation]] of the musical ''[[Into the Woods]]'' (2014).<ref>[http://broadwayworld.com/article/James-Corden-Joins-Streep-Depp-In-INTO-THE-WOODS-Movie-20130510 James Corden Joins Streep & Depp In INTO THE WOODS Movie], broadwayworld.com; accessed 28 December 2014.</ref> In 2016 he appeared in the animated comedy film ''[[Trolls (film)|Trolls]]'' as Biggie, a chubby friendly Troll.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/JKCorden/status/684781501414690816 |title=Hair we go! Meet Biggie! #DreamWorksTrolls #TheySeeMeTrollin |publisher=Twitter |last1=Corden |first1=James |date=January 6, 2016 |accessdate=January 6, 2016}}</ref>
===''The Wrong Mans''=== For his next project, Corden teamed with friend and fellow ''Gavin & Stacey'' star [[Mathew Baynton]] to create, write and star in ''[[The Wrong Mans (UK TV series)|The Wrong Mans]]'', a six-part comedy-thriller for [[BBC Two]]. The premiere was on 24 September 2013.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/mediacentre/latestnews/2012/the-wrong-mans.html|title=BBC Two announces new comedy, The Wrong Mans|date=9 Oct 2012|work=BBC Media Centre|accessdate=10 October 2012}}</ref> The series was co-produced by online television provider [[Hulu.com]] in the United States where it began airing in November 2013.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.variety.com/article/VR1118060475|title=BBC, Hulu team on James Corden laffer|date=9 October 2012|work=Variety online|accessdate=10 October 2012}}</ref>
===''The Late Late Show''=== {{main|The Late Late Show with James Corden}} On 23 March 2015 Corden succeeded [[Craig Ferguson]] as host of the American [[late-night talk show]] ''[[The Late Late Show (U.S. TV series)|The Late Late Show]]''.<ref name="corden">{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2014/09/09/business/media/james-corden-to-replace-craig-ferguson-as-host-of-the-late-late-show-on-cbs.html|title=James Corden to Replace Craig Ferguson as Host of 'The Late, Late Show' on CBS|date=8 September 2014|work=[[The New York Times]]|last1=Carter|first1=Bill|accessdate=8 September 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Kondolojy|first=Amanda|title='The Late Late Show With James Corden' to Premiere March 2015|url=http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2014/10/23/the-late-late-show-with-james-corden-to-premiere-monday-march-9-2015/318588|accessdate=23 October 2014|work=[[TV by the Numbers]]|date=23 October 2014|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141025175929/http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2014/10/23/the-late-late-show-with-james-corden-to-premiere-monday-march-9-2015/318588/|archivedate=25 October 2014|df=dmy-all}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|author=Brian Steinberg|url=https://variety.com/2014/tv/news/cbs-pushes-james-cordens-debut-on-late-late-show-to-march-23-1201378083|title=CBS Pushes James Corden’s Debut On 'Late Late Show' To March 23|work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]|date=12 December 2014|accessdate=13 December 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url= http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3008853/James-Corden-portrays-unknown-Brit-Late-Late-debut-Jay-Leno-waterboards-preparation-audience-worked-them.html|title=Has James Corden cracked America? British comedian is joined by impressive list of A-list guests for his debut on new late night US chat show.... as viewers and critics deliver their verdict|date=24 March 2015|work= Daily Mail|accessdate=24 March 2015}}</ref> Corden's [[Carpool Karaoke]] through the streets of London with pop singer [[Adele]], a sketch which featured on his talk show in January 2016, was the biggest YouTube viral video of 2016.<ref>{{cite news|title=James Corden's Adele Carpool Karaoke biggest YouTube viral video of 2016|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/music/news/james-corden-adele-carpool-karaoke-annual-youtube-list-viral-videos-2016-fifth-harmony-work-from-a7460511.html|last=Stolworthy|first=Jacob|work=The Independent|date=7 December 2016}}</ref>
==Influences== Corden has said that his comedy influences are [[Graham Norton]], [[Chris Evans (presenter)|Chris Evans]], [[Jonathan Ross]],<ref>{{cite web|url=http://m.hollywoodreporter.com/entry/view/id/894577|title=James Corden talks ''Late Late Show'' plans, influences, and competition|work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|date=12 January 2015|accessdate=7 June 2015}}</ref> [[Conan O'Brien]],<ref>{{cite web|url=http://teamcoco.com/celebs/james-corden|title=James Corden: Conan|publisher=team coco|date=26 March 2015|accessdate=7 June 2015}}</ref> [[David Letterman]],<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/tv/videos/sting-james-corden-sing-so-long-to-david-letterman-20150521 |title= Sting, James Corden Sing So Long to David Letterman |publisher=[[Rolling Stone]] |accessdate=9 June 2015}}</ref> and [[Stephen Colbert]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://deadline.com/2014/12/stephen-colbert-scares-james-corden-1201317705/ |title= Stephen Colbert scares James Corden |website=[[Deadline Hollywood]] |accessdate=9 June 2015}}</ref>
==Personal life== Corden shared a flat with his ''The History Boys'' co-star [[Dominic Cooper]] for several years.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rYCinkqvxJs|title=Dominic Cooper & James Corden Were Roommates|first=|last=The Late Late Show with James Corden|date=17 May 2016|publisher=|via=YouTube}}</ref> Cooper introduced Corden to his future wife Julia Carey, whom Cooper had known for years.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/p0455bjb|title=Dominic Cooper on James Corden: "I knew the first day I met him...", John Malkovich, Dominic Cooper, Sophie Ellis-Bextor and a Strictly Come Dancing announcement, The Chris Evans Breakfast Show - BBC Radio 2|website=BBC|access-date=2017-06-30}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ET-Ggl509CY|title=Kristin Chenoweth Forgives You|first=|last=The Late Late Show with James Corden|date=17 May 2016|publisher=|via=YouTube}}</ref> Corden married Carey on 15 September 2012.<ref name="PersonalMultiple"/> The Cordens have three children: son Max (born 22 March 2011), and daughters Carey (born 27 October 2014)<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.belfasttelegraph.co.uk/entertainment/news/james-corden-welcomes-baby-girl-30704928.html|title=James Corden welcomes baby girl|date=30 October 2014|work=[[Belfast Telegraph]]|accessdate=30 October 2014}}</ref> and Charlotte (born 12 December 2017).<ref>{{cite news |title=There’s Another Corden Baby on the Way! James and Wife Julia Are Expecting Their Third Child |url=http://people.com/babies/james-corden-and-julia-expecting-third-baby/ |first=Yvonne |last=Juris |work=[[People (magazine)|People]] |date=July 8, 2017}}</ref> Cooper is Max's godfather.
Corden is a supporter of [[Premier League]] football club [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://talksport.com/football/james-corden-west-ham-ravel-morrison-and-england-13100863219|title=James Corden on West Ham, Ravel Morrison and England|first=|last=talkSPORT|date=8 October 2013|publisher=|accessdate=30 October 2016}}</ref>
Corden was appointed [[Officer of the Order of the British Empire]] (OBE) in the [[2015 New Year Honours]] for services to drama.<ref>{{London Gazette|issue=61092 |supp=y|page=N12|date=31 December 2014}}</ref><ref>[https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/391413/New_Year_Honours_List_2015.pdf 2015 New Year Honours List] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150102104907/https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/391413/New_Year_Honours_List_2015.pdf |date= 2 January 2015 }}</ref> He received the honour from [[Anne, Princess Royal|Princess Anne]] during a ceremony at [[Buckingham Palace]] on 25 June 2015.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Percival|first1=Ashley|title=James Corden Receives OBE From Princess Anne At Buckingham Palace Investiture|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/2015/06/25/james-corden-obe-buckingham-palace-princess-anne_n_7663462.html|accessdate=25 June 2015|work=The Huffington Post UK|date=25 June 2015}}</ref>
==Filmography==

Soldier Vernkot (voice) || |- | rowspan="2"|2010 || ''[[Gulliver's Travels (2010 film)|Gulliver's Travels]]'' || Jinks || |- | ''[[Animals United]]'' || Billy the Meerkat (voice) || English dub |- | 2011 || ''[[The Three Musketeers (2011 film)|The Three Musketeers]]'' || Planchet || |- | rowspan="2"| 2013 || ''[[One Chance (film)|One Chance]]'' || [[Paul Potts]] || |- | ''[[Begin Again ''[[The Emoji Movie]]''<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/emoji-movie-cast-james-corden-936821|title=James Corden, Ilana Glazer Join Animated 'EmojiMovie'|publisher=|accessdate=30 October 2016}}</ref> || Hi-5 (voice) || |- | rowspan="4"|2018 || ''[[Peter Rabbit (film)|Peter Rabbit]]'' || [[Peter Rabbit]] (voice) || |- | ''[[Ocean's 8]]'' ||
